Dear Sheffield City Council,
Under the Freedom of Information Act 2000, I request the following information for 1-, 2-, 3-, 4-, and 5-bedroom properties (defined as discrete bedroom counts, excluding converted living spaces).
1. Property Inventory (as of 20 January 2025).
1.a. Total residential dwellings (occupied + void)
1.b. Average floor area (m2) using RICS Code of Measured Practice (6th ed.)
1.c. Property classification:
- Council-owned
- Housing association managed
- Temporary accommodation
2. Damp/Mould Status (as of 20 January 2025), split down for each of the 5 size dwellings as per above.
2.a. Active damp cases
2.b. Active mould cases
3.a. Properties in remediation for damp/mould
3. Overcrowding Analysis (as of 20 January 2025), split down for each of the 5 size dwellings as per above.
3.a. Properties violating Room Standard (Housing Act 1985 s.325)
4. Request specifications:
4.a. Current data (updated within last 6 months)
4.b. Machine-readable CSV/Excel
4.c. If any data isn't held, please confirm in detail readings under Section 16 FOIA.
Please acknowledge request within 3 working days. If any aspect requires clarification, I would welcome early contact via this portal.
Statutory deadline: 20 working days from receipt (FOIA s.10(1)).
Many thanks
Yours faithfully,
Brad Clark

Dear Brad Clark,

Dear Brad Clark,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Housing Portfolio
Analysis which we received on 20/02/2025.
We have reclassified your request, and it will now be processed under the
Environmental Information Regulations.
Regulation 7(1) of The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 (EIR)
enables an authority to extend the 20-working day limit up to 40 working
days if it reasonably believes that the complexity and volume of the
information requested means that it is impracticable either to comply with
the request within the earlier period or to make a decision to refuse to
do so.
In this case, we do reasonably believe that the volume and complexity of
the request makes it impracticable to comply within the 20-working day
limit, and consequently we are extending the deadline by an additional 20
days until 22/04/2025.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
